revision.comment: Change broken clovelly recordings link to iTunes
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2015}} {{Use British English|date=February 2015}} [[File:RAF Wyton band.JPG|thumb|200px|RAF Wyton AVB perform during the RAF Wyton and Brampton [[Freedom of the City|Freedom]] of [[Huntingdon]] parade on 12 April 2011.<ref>[http://www.huntspost.co.uk/news/latest-news/crowds_cheer_freedom_parade_through_huntingdon_1_863733 Crowds cheer Freedom Parade through Huntingdon], ''Hunts Post'', 13 April 2011</ref>]] '''RAF Wyton Area Voluntary Band''' is one of eight [[RAF Voluntary Bands|Voluntary bands]] within the [[Royal Air Force]] providing musical support to the RAF and local communities. Founded in 1955, the [[military band]] is based at [[RAF Wyton]] in Cambridgeshire and is under the administration of [[RAF Brampton Wyton Henlow]].<ref>[http://www.raf.mod.uk/rafbramptonwytonhenlow/aboutus/wavb.cfm RAF Brampton Wyton Henlow], URL accessed 3 December 2009</ref><ref>''Rhythm in Blue'', CD notes (2005)</ref> Its membership consists of volunteer musicians from local RAF stations ([[RAF Wyton|Wyton]], [[RAF Brampton|Brampton]], [[RAF Henlow|Henlow]], [[RAF Cottesmore|Cottesmore]], [[RAF Marham|Marham]] and [[RAF Wittering|Wittering]]) and members of the local community.
The [[concert band]] appear regularly at military events, civic parades, church services and charity concerts, largely in the East of England, although the band have also performed in London, Birmingham and toured in [[Cyprus]].<ref>[http://www.wytonband.co.uk/ RAF WAVB website], URL accessed 3 December 2009</ref> The band also have a [[big band]], "Rhythm in Blue", and can also provide a fanfare team, and clarinet or brass quintets. Under bandmaster Graham Sheldon, they have produced a number of widely available CDs.<ref>[https://itunes.apple.com/us/artist/royal-air-force-wyton-area/id219060253 iTunes], URL accessed 3 December 2009</ref>
On 28 February 2015 RAF Wyton Area Voluntary Band became the first of the [[RAF Voluntary Bands]] to ever perform alongside the [[Central Band of the Royal Air Force]].<ref>[http://www.raf.mod.uk/news/archive/raf-bands-in-historic-concert-at-peterborough-cathedral-04032015 RAF News], URL accessed 15 May 2015</ref>
==See also== *[[RAF Waddington Voluntary band]], the band for Central England.
